ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Pulsatile tinnitus secondary to temporal bone dehiscence
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Imaging confirmed dehiscence between the Eustachian tube and internal carotid artery; symptoms were mechanically triggered by hearing aid contact and resolved with device modification.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Vascular abnormalities (e.g., AVM, glomus tumor)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Serious vascular causes of pulsatile tinnitus were considered but ruled out by cardiology evaluation and imaging.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Routine baseline examination to assess hearing thresholds.
Routine baseline examination to assess speech recognition.
Troubleshooting with cotton ball to determine if mechanical pressure resolves the pulsatile tinnitus.
To visualize temporal bone anatomy and rule out vascular pathology causing pulsatile tinnitus.
Device modification (Redwing) to reduce canal contact and eliminate symptom transmission.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Routine evaluation revealed symmetric moderate-to-profound sensorineural hearing loss with poor-to-fair word recognition, stable since 2013.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 65 dB HL AU; WRS 48% (Right) and 64% (Left) at 95 dB HL.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial fit of new ITE devices. Patient reported immediate pulsatile tinnitus in the left ear. Fine-tuning adjustments (gain reduction) were unsuccessful.
New open jaw earmold impressions were made and the device was remade with a larger vent, but the pulsatile tinnitus persisted.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Remake with larger vent failed to resolve pulsatile tinnitus.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Troubleshooting visit. Mechanical manipulation (wedging a cotton ball) eliminated the pulsatile tinnitus, suggesting a physical fit issue rather than gain settings.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Physical pressure on the device near the triangular fossa (cotton ball) eliminated the pulsatile tinnitus.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Helix modification failed to resolve symptoms. Patient disclosed pacemaker history. Devices sent to replicate physical fit of previous successful hearing aids.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Helix build-up modification failed. Old devices sent for physical replication.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Cardiology evaluation yielded no findings. Recommended gain reduction (2000-4000 Hz) was attempted but ineffective.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Cardiology clearance obtained. Gain reduction at 2000-4000 Hz failed to relieve tinnitus.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Imaging revealed a temporal bone dehiscence. Based on this, the hearing aid was modified to reduce canal contact, which successfully resolved the pulsatile tinnitus.

tests.name: Imaging (CT Scan)
tests.result_summary: Dehiscence of the temporal bone portion separating the Eustachian tube from the internal carotid artery.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Redwing modification (tapering the device end) reduced canal contact and relieved the pulsatile tinnitus.

proposed_items: Hearing aid modification (Redwing modification/tapering of canal portion)
counseling_actions: Explain that the pulsatile tinnitus is caused by the hearing aid physically transmitting the heartbeat due to a thinning of the bone near the carotid artery
Reassure the patient that the condition is benign following medical clearance
Discuss the rationale for the device modification to reduce contact with the sensitive area

escalation.rationale_short: To rule out serious vascular conditions (e.g., aneurysms, tumors) associated with pulsatile tinnitus.

follow_up_plan.objective: To ensure the pulsatile tinnitus has not returned and the device fit remains comfortable.

expected_outcome: Left temporal bone dehiscence was identified as the root cause of the pulsatile tinnitus when wearing the hearing device.
After physical manipulation of the custom hearing instrument (Redwing modification), the patient reported satisfaction and relief from his pulsatile tinnitus.
The patient reported no further issues with left pulsatile tinnitus at 1- and 2-week follow-up checks.
